DOC.brief_summary: In old , normal-weight woman ( 60-75 yr , BMI=18-28 kg/m2 ) , acute bout higher-intensity ( 60 % maximum effort ) aerobic exercise , comparison isocaloric bout lower-intensity ( 45 % maximum effort ) exercise ( caloric expenditure 3.5 kcal/kg body weight ) , result differential : 1. decline non-exercise activity calorie expenditure subsequent 48 hour exercise ; 2. increase rest metabolic rate 48 hour exercise ; 3. increase serum free triiodo-L-thyronine ( free T3 ) concentration immediately follow exercise ; 4. decline pre-exercise plasma leptin serum free T3 concentration 48 hour exercise .
DOC.brief_title: Energy Expenditure Responses Acute Exercise Older Women ( Calorie Expenditure Exercise )
DOC.criteria: 1 . Women 2 . Age 6075 year 3. normal weight 4 . Weightstable ( Â± 5 % ) within previous 3 month 5 . Nonsmoking last year 6 . Able provide transportation study visit 7 . Not currently involve research study 8 . Willing able participate aspect trial include research test 9 . Willing give inform consent participate 1 . Selfreported significant cardiovascular disease 2 . Other selfreported medical condition diabetes , chronic recurrent respiratory condition , active cancer , musculoskeletal disease 3 . Medications know affect exercise performance metabolism 4 . Excess caffeine use ( > 500mg/day ) 5 . Any selfreported contraindication exercise 6 . Clinical depression 7 . Abnormal cognitive function
